name: Grand Hyatt Tampa Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a couple of problems the last time we stayed at this property, but decided to give it a go again.
reviews.title: Much Improved Over Last Visit

likes.liked: — The professionalism of the staff and the high quality of the food and guest rooms.

reviews.text: First, I must say this is a beautiful hotel. It is elegant, yet relaxed. Our room was top-notch: quiet, comfortable and a lovely view. The bed was comfy and the pillows were heavenly.
reviews.title: Somewhat dissapointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel provided two luggage racks for both our suitcases. This was important because my husband threw his back out on this trip and ended up at a local chiropractor.
reviews.title: Lovely, quiet room

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was to die for! I don't think either one of us can be described as a "foodie," but we enjoy good food. The presentation, variety, quantity of food on the buffet was unbelieveable.
reviews.title: Tampa Grand Hyatt

reviews.text: We will definitely return to this hotel!
reviews.title: Time Out In Tampa

reviews.text: I was on a business trip and we were directed to stay at the Hyatt. I knew it was in the category of a airport hotel but most of the time we would be working. I saw where some had complained that it wan't near anything but that is why it is near the airport and is an airport hotel. My daughter was with us and had her dog so she had to stay in their villas. I was given the option to stay near her. When I asked what was recommended, that was suggested. The rooms were excellent. Large rooms and very quiet. We ate at both Petey Browns and Oystercatchers. Both were outstanding. One morning we were waiting outside for our ride and the manager of Oystercatchers saw us and brought out bottles of cold water to us for our ride. Little things like that make a stay special.
reviews.title: The service exceed my expectation

reviews.text: As I am sitting here eating my last breakfast at the Grand Hyatt Tampa, I am trying to think of anything that was wrong with my stay and surprisingly nothing comes to mind. The hotel staff was polite and efficient, the room was clean and roomy, the room service was quick, the restaurant food was pricy but good. Overall a pleasant experience.
reviews.title: Can't find anything wrong!

reviews.text: I would not consider this to be a vacation hotel. It's location does not lend itself to a family vacation. You cannot walk to anywhere. But it does have a free shuttle that will take you over to the international mall that has plenty of great restaurants. With that said, as a business or travel hotel (the airport is next door) you can't go wrong.
reviews.title: Excellent service with a smile... at a lovely hotel

reviews.text: I am a Hilton Diamond hhonors member, but this Hyatt has me thinking that maybe I should change my loyalty! Well done Hyatt.
reviews.title: Lost at the Grand Hyatt

reviews.text: First off I must say that the staff at this hotel is great. Everyone and I do mean everyone was very friendly and helpful. So right off that alone makes a great stay at any hotel, but this hotel is also lovely.
reviews.title: Overall a great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt on our wedding night, as we were flying out of Tampa International the next day. Our room was a king suite overlooking Tampa Bay, and though the bed was large and the room seemed well-kept, the service was not exceptionally cordial and many charges were hidden. When we arrived in our room, there was a bottle of Aquafina water on the counter, so naturally, we drank it. Hours later, we found a small sign on the minibar stating that the Aquafina water (which could be purchased at 7-11 for $1) was $8.00, but the other types of water locked in the minibar were much less money. If you stay here, there are great views, a beautiful pool, and a dock which takes you through groves out to the bay, but beware the hidden fees.
reviews.title: Beautiful, but hidden charges

reviews.text: After researching for hotels in Tampa, I decided on this hotel since it is a full service hotel. I orginally made reservations for the Hyatt place Busch gardens, but this hotel really shines. We traveled with 2 toddlers. Being that it was July 4 weekend, most of the hotels on the beach were booked or were outrageously expensive.
reviews.title: Elegant and reasonable price

reviews.text: With AAA rate, we paid $109 for first night and $129 on weekends. Regular rate was $139 so even that this price you get luxury at a lot less. Most other Hyatt costs more.. this was pretty much close to Hyatt Place.
reviews.title: A Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since we were flying stand by, we booked this hotel after we rented a car. This hotel is close to airport (even has complimentary shuttle service) and also be close driving distance to Busch Gardens, Clearwater beach ( 20 min), Aquarium (15 min), and St. Petersburg (25min).
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

likes.liked: — Optional Valet, Nature walk to Bay, and price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we drove into the hotel entraced lined with palm trees, we parked to check in and valet service greeted us. The felow had a white and gold trimmed uniform. There were someone to open doors for us. There is complimentary parking in there garage. This is important since almost everywhere had a hidden parking fee. The lobby had fresh cut flowers and marbled floor. I think there was a wedding held there. The rooms were double beds.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: Had to stay one night at this hotel on business trip. Arrived rather late, almost at midnight. Be able to get full menu dinner at the bar. Service and food was superior!!
reviews.title: business trip

reviews.text: Room was with bay view, just breath taking. Room is extremely clean as well.
reviews.title: Very good but not Superb

reviews.text: Breakfast in the morning more then you can ask for.
reviews.title: A Nice Property but a Few Negatives

reviews.text: Highly recomend for business travelers. Special thanks to Michael -front desk personal for his hospitality.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.text: Just spent a week at the Grand Hyatt Tampa Bay and I can only say that I was underwhelmed. This is not to say that it was bad. It was actually a very nice resort. The grounds are beautiful. Everything is well manicured. There is a trio of restaurants, internet access for a fee, and plenty of parking (included with your stay). In general, the staff is very friendly.
reviews.title: "Stay away from the Grand Hyatt Tampa."

reviews.text: I stayed at this property last year, and the exact same construction is going on directly in front of the property. Getting to this property takes some skill! In approaching from I-275, if you are in the wrong lane and miss the 12"X12" sign that shallowly states HYATT, then you are screwed for about 7 miles across the causeway-then back again, and once again, it is difficult to know which way to go. I repeat, if you do not know Tampa, this is probably not a good hotel to stay at if you are going to be going out on road trips over to St. Pete etc.
reviews.title: Well....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reservation was for the business class room which included breakfast for two nights. The room was NOT on the business class floor. Although a standard room, it was large with a good ( not great) view of the bay. Nice bathroom. POD type coffee brewer in room. No fridge except the bar fridge which a key is required. No microwave. No snack vending-only from the lobby snack shop which is not 24/7 open. The breakfast that is included does not include room service fees even though they do not tell you that upon check in nor when ordering via room service. Argued with mgmt until they dropped the room- service fees.
reviews.title: Great Experience

likes.liked: — The rooms were modern and spacious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent food. Nice pool and lawn chairs.
reviews.title: Average overnight at the Grand Hyatt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Remember to bring all snacks and any other items you may need for the evening. Not sure how many miles to the nearest store and then you WILL get lost due to construction coming back!
reviews.title: Simply average

likes.liked: — Good air conditioning and comfortable bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rates are not cheap here. Just a tip-across the Courtney Campbell Causeway in Rocky Point is a Holiday Inn right on the water. There is a restaurant really close and other businesses. This might also be worth looking into as it is much easier to get into and out of and it HAS to be less expensive. ( Hyatt $179.00 + tx per)
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.text: From the moment I arrived the hotel staff were helpful and attentive. My Bayview King Rooom had a view to die for and the room was classy and comfy with decor ideal for male or female tastes. After a long day travelling to my destination I lay down for a short nap which ended six hours later. I was able to order a lovely meal at 1:55 am with delivery in only 20 minutes. By 3:00 am I was enjoying the heated pool and hottub. Aside from two raccoons keeping me company I was the only two legged creature. The pool and hottub were warm and clean. The pool deck needed to be cleared of the odd towel, cocktail napkin and beer cap from earlier guests but I suspect at first light the pool deck will be spotless. I will be back!
reviews.title: Dreamy Destination

reviews.text: The Grand Hyatt in Westshore was always good with its excellent restaurants, Armani and Oyster Catchers and I have been staying or eating there or both since it first opened. Perhaps the restaurants arnt quite as special as when they first opened say 20 years ago or more and theres no longer, at this moment, the superb buffet lunch they used to provide in the main dining room. I have recommended many over the years to stay here for the great views and great hospitality and choice of restaurants and my european friends in particular have loved the place. BUT now its better than ever or at least the rooms and the great team running the place are. Management and marketing are doing a superb job. The newly decorated rooms are great and quiet and the staff are fabulous. Everyone is really trying here . The views are the same fabulous ones they always were but the newly decorated rooms are bang up to date and modern in style and very comfortable and the staff will go to every length to make you feel welcome and at home. Stay here and you can be assured you are getting some of the best hospitality available in Tampa Bay..............and not just that businessmens chain hotel vibe..... now a good hotel being made better than it when it was new
reviews.title: ALWAYS GOOD.. NOW BETTER THAN NEW

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a casita at this hotel and while the property and the room was beautiful, the noise of the planes taking off at Tampa airport was very loud! We ate breakfast at the hotel which was a distance away...there is a little path to the hotel. Overall, it was a nice experience.
reviews.title: Alot of Plane noise!

reviews.text: A grand gem on the water in Tampa. Having lived and worked in Tampa before, there is no greater getaway from traveling or work than to arrive at this property. Walk paths to the bay or suites away from the hotel, this property has everything to offer world class travelers and families.
reviews.title: A remodeled gem in Tampa

reviews.text: Love the renovation! The last time we stayed her was pre room reno - WOW! The rooms are clean, beautiful and modern. Their new key system is cool because you cannot de-magnetize them.
reviews.title: Beautiful rooms!

reviews.text: Great customer service T check in ~ nice rooms. Got upgraded to corner suite; unfortunately we did get stuck on the floor with probably 30 High School Graduates celebrating which did lead to a sleepless night - celebrated until 3am
reviews.title: Weekend Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Called the front desk several times, not sure if a security guard ever showed up but we did get a free breakfast voucher which was nice and considerate.
reviews.title: Nothing specail

likes.disliked: — Felt like I overpaid for a standard 3 star room.

reviews.text: The setting is beautiful in a natuire preserve area - just be warned of the mosquitos. We went to their restaurant OYSTERCATCHER which is at a beautiful romantic location. However, if you are hungry be warned : it took the service 1.5 hrs (!!!) to bring our dinner- by then we were all eaten up by the mosquuitos due to the location at the saltwater. If you prefer to sit inside you wll have great views as well, very contemporary
reviews.title: No real complaints

reviews.text: Not sure what everyone is raving about or how this is a 4 star hotel. Stayed here for 5 nights as a base to visit Sarasota, Clearwater, Bush Gardens and do some shopping for our anniversary.
reviews.title: Wonderul place to stay near TPA

reviews.text: Negatives:
reviews.title: We'll be back for sure!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

likes.liked: — The comfortable beds, beautiful decor, friendly staff

reviews.text: I read several Trip Advisor reviews and the negative votes don't quite capture this place. This place is a fantastic spot to spend an overnight on your way to another destination. The property itself is resort-like - with resort-like prices. That said, it's not a resort location (e.g., five minutes from the airport, small man-made beach with no access to ocean, etc.).
reviews.title: Great Airport Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is absolutely nothing wrong with the place, but it's not what I think of when I think 5 star perfect location.
reviews.title: Beautiful casitas!

reviews.text: We came from England, so we were very tired .
reviews.title: Excellent customer service

reviews.text: We decided to sleep near the airport for our first night. We choose this hotel but no inside the big building .
reviews.title: Quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We preferred to stay in the casitas near the water. It was an excellent idea because the room was beautiful , quiet , near a nice swimming pool and the restaurant Oyster's catcher.
reviews.title: Very, very nice facility.

description: 445-deluxe guest room business resort hotel in a relaxed setting offering 45 Spanish-style villas, 23 suites, Hyatt Business Plan and exclusive Regency Club accommodations. We are the only 4-Diamond hotel in Tampa, located on a 35-acre wildlife preserve on the spectacular shores of Tampa Bay, conveniently located five minutes to Tampa International Airport and International Plaza mall.
